div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 12:53 pm CDT

div.div: Mostly sunny, with a high near 65. Northeast wind 10 to 15 mph.
A 10 percent chance of showers after 5am. Mostly clear, with a low around 41. Northeast wind 5 to 10 mph becoming light and variable after midnight.

A chance of showers and thunderstorms before 10am, then a slight chance of showers between 10am and 1pm. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 71. South wind 5 to 15 mph becoming northwest in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

span.strong: Preschool Pre-Enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year is beginning!

span.span: Most paperwork will be completed through USD 434 enrollment in July. However, this form needs to be completed before May 1 for all students who plan to attend in the fall. If you prefer a paper copy, please let us know and one can be mailed. We are looking forward to another great year!
Children must be three years of age on or before August 31st.
The preschool is located at 104 S. Burlingame Ave, Scranton, KS.
Classes are .5 day sessions Monday-Friday first semester and Monday-Thursday second semester.
Shuttle transportation is provided from Carbondale and Overbrook attendance centers to the preschool site.
There is no charge for the preschool services.
For more information call

a.aria-label: Read more about Preschool Enrollment Information

h3.a: School at Home Continuous Learning Plan USD 434 Santa Fe Trail

span.a: School at Home Continuous Learning Plan USD 434 Santa Fe Trail

span.span: The Continuous Learning Task Force in Kansas has issued a guidance document to all schools, which provides the outline for planning and administration of learning for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. USD 434 will closely follow the guidance provided. We will use a digital instructional system and paper-pencil homework packets for those who do not have digital access. We will be contacting each student household to determine what the needs are for each student. Learning materials will be provided for students based on needs identified.
Listed below are the maximum daily minutes which include teacher instruction and homework time.
PreK Grades 30 minutes
K-1 Grades 45 minutes
2-3 Grades 60 minutes
4-5 Grades 90 minutes
6-12 Grades 30 minutes per teacher (3 hours max in a day)
PreK-12th grade students will begin on Monday, March 30th with the plan outlined below:

All students PK-12 will have the opportunity to pick up a device (Chromebook/iPad) during lunch distribution at their child’s school from 11:00 am - 12:30 pm, Wednesday, March 25, Thursday, March 26, and Friday, March 27. This will ensure students have what they need and are ready to learn Monday, March 30. (Reminder: There is no food distribution at the high school, but it will be available for drive-thru Chromebook pick-up if needed on the dates and times listed above.)

At this time, students will ONLY be picking up their device. They will not be allowed in the building. ​All other student items remaining at the school will be picked up at a later date. This includes items in their lockers and instruments, etc.
Preschool:

Preschool teachers will use SeeSaw to deliver instructional materials to students/parents. Teachers will post a daily lesson on SeeSaw with activities that incorporate multiple areas of development. Parents can do these activities at home with their children and they should take no more than 30 minutes. Teachers may also post videos of themselves demonstrating an activity for the students. SeeSaw will also be the primary source for communication with parents. Preschool teachers have established office hours (listed in table below) at which time parents may contact the teacher with questions and for help for their child. Preschool lessons/activities will be provided Monday through Thursday, to match our normal school schedule for the spring semester. Teachers will still be available during office hours on Fridays.
District-Wide System of Delivery:

Students will access Google Classroom for instruction, communication with their teacher, and live Zoom interactions. Parent correspondence will be done via email or phone call as well as through Google Classroom during teacher “office hours.” Zoom links will be provided through Google Classroom. If at any time there is a technology problem or the teacher is unavailable, the student will shift to independent work until the next class opportunity.

All teachers will communicate through Google Classroom by posting assignments, links, documents, and other related materials. They may also prepare short videos of instruction. They will also set up Zoom meetings, which are meetings that they can hold with students or an entire class live. The GoGuardian software will also still be active and teachers will be able to monitor websites and activities through the Chromebooks. GoGuardian does not extend to the iPads, so parents will need a plan to monitor appropriate usage.
Professional development plan:

We will use a variety of methods to assist our teachers as they prepare for continuous learning in an online setting. We have some local experts who are willing to help their colleagues. In addition, we have identified resources for our teachers and online instruction for their use. We are also collaborating with Greenbush professional development providers to provide a consistent training. We are conducting at least weekly collaboration meetings virtually with staff in an effort to learn what their needs are and provide support in those areas. We have limited the platforms we will use to those most familiar to our staff and students. By limiting these options, we hope to reduce the need for professional devotement in this area.

Technology support for teachers will be provided as needed to instruct them on the use of the required tools above. Teaches are to contact their building principal if support is needed and the principal will set up a training session by sending a tech request. Tech staff will then set up a training for all staff who need the training. Zoom will be used for these training sessions or if possible, an instructional video will be sent to staff to assist them. Staff are also encouraged to talk to other staff members who are familiar with the technology and seek help from them. We must all support one another as we work our way through this.
Technology Support for Students:

Students who are experiencing difficulties will be asked to communicate with their teachers and inform them of the problem. Their teacher will make a request for assistance through a tech request. Tech staff will then contact the student to provide the needed assistance. We are also posting some trouble shooting tips on our website that may help solve some issues. We are also posting instructional videos online that will assist with some issues.
Special Education:

Special education services and support will be provided to all students with an IEP. We will have a support system for students through telephone or via the internet. Students will be able to join a Zoom meeting where support staff will be available to answer questions and get instruction as needed. In addition, students without internet service will receive resource packets and teachers will make themselves available via telephone. Teachers will set a schedule for the Zoom meetings and telephone calls to compliment the online classes set by regular education teachers. To provide instruction the special education teachers will be providing instruction through the use of Google Classroom and packets specialized to the needs of the students they teach. Support for these students will be handled via telephone call and if available, Zoom will also be used. It should be noted that special education staff will communicate with preschool students/parents through the use of SeeSaw. Students/parents will be given “choice boards” created to give families options to choose from a list of activities that work best for their child and will give practice on their child’s specific needs. Related services will collaborate with teachers and families on how best to incorporate activities for their goals.
Social/Emotional Support:

Counselors will maintain regular meeting schedules checking in with students who have existing needs. In addition, as teachers, parents, and students express concerns relevant to newly identified needs, counselors will accept referrals and check in on those students as well ensuring students have the resources and support necessary through this critical time. We will also provide helpful tips to alleviate stress and promote a healthy mindset at home. We will post these on Facebook, our district website and send them out through our teachers Google Classroom which students will check daily. We will also provide contact information for Crosswinds Counseling and Wellness (PH: 620-343-2211, 608 Holliday Street, Osage City, KS 66523). Crosswinds currently has an office in our buildings and serves some of our students. We want those services to continue uninterrupted. Crosswinds has also told us that they are setting up a team to assist all families who need their services during this crisis.
Office hours scheduled by grade level/subject area:
Teachers will be available during this time through Google Classroom, email, phone, and if set up by the teacher, Zoom.
Monday - Friday
Grade / Subject

span.span: Communication plan:
Our official communication outlets during this time are the USD 434 messenger, USD 434 Facebook page, and school website at ​www.usd434.org​.
When technology or learning issues arise for students, please email the classroom teacher directly and allow them some time to work with you to resolve the issue.
John Denk, Superintendent
Patrick Graham, SFT High School Principal
Diann Faflick, CAC Principal
Zach Harwood, CAC Assistant Principal
Vici Jennings, OAC Principal
Sean Nelson, Technology Director
Regan Erickson, SFT Athletic Director

a.aria-label: Read more about COVID-19 Information

p.a: April 3, 2020

hr.p: Dear Santa Fe Trail Family,

We have reached the end of our first week of continuous learning. I hope it has gone well for you and your child this week. We know there are things that need to be adjusted to make it better and we are seeking your input through a survey that was sent on Thursday (please use the “updated” version). Your feedback is very helpful to us in adjusting our learning process to fit the needs of your student(s). Please take a few minutes to fill out this survey for each of your children. We want to hear from you so we can make this process work as smoothly and uncomplicated as we can. We are all learning as we go; two-way communication will be the key to success. Thank you for your help as we grow and learn.

After viewing the results, we will come out with updates and tweaks to the continuous learning plan on Tuesday or Wednesday of next week. These adjustments should help improve the learning process. Look for a message from your child(s) teacher and/or a message from me. In the meantime, please don’t let this process cause you or your child stress. We will work with you. As long as your child is participating in the process, we will be very forgiving. Participation is the key--not the amount of work completed. We understand that families are dealing with many issues of their own during this time, and we do not want to add any more stress to an already difficult situation.

I have a couple of announcements related to school and food service. First, there will be no school (continuous learning) on Friday, April 10 or Monday, April 13. This will give families, students and staff a chance to take a deep breath and relax while observing the holiday. Second, there will be no food service on April 10 and April 13. We will, however, provide additional food on Thursday, March 9 that will help get students through Friday with some additional items from Harvesters to supplement during the weekend. We will resume curbside food service operations on Tuesday, April 14 from 11:00 – 12:30. We are sorry for any inconvenience this my cause.
John Denk, Superintendent

span.span: March 28, 2020
Santa Fe Trail Families,

Good News, we are about to begin providing education again on Monday, March 30, 2020. Teachers have been hard at work for the past week getting ready to provide learning opportunities for our students. I want to remind everyone that we will be using Google Classroom as our primary source of instruction delivery and communication. Email and telephone will also be used as communication methods. Emails may be coming to your student’s school email or to their Google Classroom, so parents please check there for information. For those without internet access we will be providing homework packets that can be picked up at your child’s school on each Monday. These packets will contain a weeks-worth of learning materials. By now most of you should have heard from your child’s teacher with information about the process going forward. If you have not heard from your child’s teacher please feel free to contact them through one of the methods outlined above. Though we have tried to create a system that will work smoothly for everyone, we know that there will be glitches. Please just let us know if you experience problems and we will work to correct the problems as we work through the next couple of weeks. With only one week to completely change how we provide education we know there will be some issues. It will take teamwork between students, families and educators to smooth out the bumps and improve as we move forward. Communication will be the key to success, please let us know if you experience problems and we will continue to keep you informed and respond to your needs. Contact your Child’s teacher or building principal if you have any problems and they will help you.

Governor Kelly issued a statewide stay at home order today, March 28. I wanted to let families know that this does not impact the plans we have made for providing education for our students. We anticipated this possibility and made plans that do not violate the order. We do want to remind everyone to maintain social distancing and follow the stay at home regulations for your safety and the safety of others. We are excited to work with our students again and collaborate with you to provide learning for the remainder of the school year.
John Denk, Superintendent
Santa Fe Trail Parents:

Yesterday, I shared with you that you might not hear from me for a day or two, but here I am again. : ) I just wanted to remind parents that we will begin distributing Chromebooks tomorrow during lunch service from 11:00 to 12:30. We are asking that you go to the school your child attends to get their Chromebook. I know that may be a bit inconvenient, but it is necessary to get your child the proper access to learning materials. Pickup will be done in a drive through fashion, so you will not need to get out of your car. We are also asking that you adhere to the following schedule for pickup:
K-8 grade students with last names beginning with A-L pickup on Wednesday from 11:00 to 12:30 at your child's school.
K-8 grade students with last names beginning with M-V pickup on Thursday from 11:00 to 12:30 at your child's school.
All remaining K-8 grade students who still need to pickup Chromebooks will pickup on Friday from 11:00 to 12:30 at your child's school.
High School Students may pickup on M, W, or F at the high school from 11:00 to 12:30.
If you cannot pickup on the day you are scheduled, please come on one of these three days that is convenient for you.

Your child's building principal will be contacting you with additional information to help guide you through the pickup process. Have a good evening, and we will continue to provide updates as they develop.

hr.p: Santa Fe Trail Families,

I wanted to touch base with families tonight to let you know what will be taking place this week. This is the week that our teachers are planning and preparing to begin delivery of student learning opportunities for the remainder of the school year. We are planning to begin lessons on Monday, March 30, if all goes as planned. Toward the end of the week we should have some information to share from your child's teachers about when and where you will go to access the learning materials. We are planning to use Google Classroom as the primary location/learning platform to place lessons online. For those without internet access, we will provide homework packets at your child's school. We will let you know when and where to get those later in the week. We are also preparing to get Chromebooks to students on Wednesday (March 25), Thursday (March 26), and Friday (March 27) during our drive through lunch service from 11:00 to 12:30. You will need to go to the school your child attends to pick up their Chromebook on one of these days. There are still questions regarding picking up items from lockers, music instruments and medications left at school. We are working on those plans, but we are placing our focus on getting ready to provide learning opportunities. Once we get that going, we will turn our attention to these issues. We will have plans for getting these items to you within the next week or two.

I will continue to update you as I have more information, but you may not hear from me for a few days while we prepare for continuous learning through the end of the year. Your teachers are working very hard to prepare for students next week. We are very proud of our teachers and staff as well as the hard work they are undergoing on behalf of our students and families. Everyone is pulling together on behalf of our students and communities. Way to go, Chargers!
John Denk
Santa Fe Trail Families,

On Thursday morning we received guidance from the KSDE task force on continuous learning for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Since that time the leadership of Santa Fe Trail USD 434 has been hard at work creating a continuous learning plan for our students. I have included the plan with this message for your reference. Please read it carefully and continue to monitor your emails for future updates as we continue to plan through next week. I wanted to give you some forewarning that a teacher of teachers from the school will be contacting you by phone to complete a survey between now and next Tuesday, March 24. This information will be critical for us to provide students and parents with the educational opportunities we are preparing to deliver. The survey will be brief and should only take a minute or two. Unfortunately, you will receive a call for each school age child you have in the district. This can't be helped and we apologies for any inconvenience this may cause. We will continue to communicate with parents as we learn more and have updated plans to share with you. Thank you for your support as we work through the planning process to provide continuous learning to our students.
John Denk, Superintendent

p.a: SFT Continuous Plan (pdf)

hr.p: March 19, 2020
Santa Fe Trail Families,

We received guidance early this morning regarding continuous education of your student(s) for the remainder of the school year. There is a great deal of information to sift through and our teachers are going to need time to plan and prepare to provide learning in ways we have never provided learning before. The state is giving us next week, March 23 through 27, for our teachers to plan and prepare. If all goes well, we hope to be ready to begin providing learning opportunities to students on March 30, 2020. We want parents to understand that this will not look like education in a traditional classroom. Much of what will be providing will be online or in homework packets that will be sent home. We will be addressing the essential learning necessary for our students to meet the competencies for this year at all grade levels and subject areas. The guidance we have received so far does say that all students will be expected to participate in these learning activities in order to earn credit and promotion to the next grade. I don’t want anyone to panic about that statement. We understand that families are dealing with their own unique difficulties during this time, and we will do everything we can to assist you and provide the necessary learning for your children. At the same time, I want to make it clear that we know that not everything we are going to try will work perfectly the first time. Our plans are going to be made to the best of our ability in a very short time frame. We are here to partner with you, work with you, and create an environment of learning in, in untraditional ways. We know there will be glitches along the way. Please, be patient and communicate with us if you experience problems. We will adjust, modify, and adapt as we go forward.

One of the first things we will do is contact you to complete a survey to determine what needs each family has. From this information, we will set up learning plans. We will keep the survey as brief as possible, but the information will be valuable to our planning process as well as the delivery of learning. This will take place over the next few days, and possibly into early next week. You will also receive a personal phone call from a staff member to gather this information. We are learning that some families are not able to access our meal program for a variety of reasons. There will be questions about your ability to access meals on the survey as well.
I will wrap by leaving you with a timeline for the next week:

ul.li: Friday, Mar. 20 the district leadership will meet to unpack the task force recommendations and organize preparations for delivering learning
Monday, March 23 - Friday, March 27 teachers planning and preparing for delivery of learning.
March 30 begin providing learning opportunities for our students (if preparations are complete).

hr.p: One last thought: of all the 36 states that have closed schools, only Kansas is making plans to continue educating our students. Only Kansas teachers could pull this off in the time frame we are given. I am proud of the teachers, staff and administration for the teamwork they have demonstrated during this crisis. We will continue to work on behalf of the students and families of Santa Fe Trail.
John Denk, Superintendent of Schools
Santa Fe Trail Families,

We have received our waiver from the state to begin serving meals to our children ages 18 and under. That means that even students who are under five years old and do not attend school are eligible to receive these meals. Meals will be provided at no charge. Meal service will begin on Thursday, March 19. Meals will be served in a curb side drive up manner. We want people to remain in their cars to limit exposure for everyone. To pick up your meals, drive up to the curb where we are serving at the appointed time, and we will hand boxed meals to you. We will serve lunch for that day and breakfast for the next morning at the same time. The meals will be boxed separately. One stipulation for providing meals is that we must see the kids in the car with you in order to provide the meals. This is a government requirement that we must comply with in order to receive the funding that allows us to serve these meals. It is also a requirement that at this time we are only allowed to serve children who live in households within our school district. Meals will be served at the schools in the following locations from 11:00 to 12:30 Monday through Friday until further notice:

We will serve meals in Scranton on the west side of the building along the curb where buses typically line up in the morning. Please drive in arriving from south to north. Pull up to the serving station with your children, and we will hand you meals for each child in the car.

At Carbondale we will serve meals on the south side of the building near the south gym doors. Please drive in from the east to the west and pull up to the curb near the serving station. We will hand you meals for each child in the car.

In Overbrook we will serve along the south side of the building near the front doors. Drive in from the east to the west and pull up to the curb near the serving station. We will hand you meals for each child in the car.

p.em: We understand that some children will not be with an adult, in this case we will allow students to use the sidewalk and grab the meals from a staff member. Please have your child bring a bag to hold their boxes while they walk back home.

hr.p: We are happy to provide this service to the families of Santa Fe Trail. We will continue to partner with you to face the challenges of this time.
Thank you, John Denk

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

font.bgcolor: Nondiscrimination Resolution In compliance with Title II of the Education Amendments Act of 1972; Title IX of the Education Amendments Act of 1972; Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973; and all the other Federal, State and District laws, regulations, and policies, the Board of Education of Santa Fe Trail USD 434, Osage County, Kansas, hereby, resolves not to discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, color, national origin, or handicap in employment, admission, access, educational programs, or activities that it operates.

div.div: Vision Statement: USD 434 is the school district of choice for those pursuing the highest quality in academic and extra-curricular experiences. The mission of Santa Fe Trail USD 434 is to support individual student needs in preparation for successful lifework
